articles.headline: TV Screen, Not Couch, Is Required for This Session
articles.snippet: A growing number of psychiatrists are using telemedicine technology to reach patients in rural swaths of the nation.
articles.abstract: A growing number of psychiatrists are using telemedicine technology to reach patients in rural swaths of the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz.  Dr. Sara Gibson looked into the television screen and got right down to it.

articles.headline: Efforts by C.I.A. Fail in Somalia, Officials Charge
articles.snippet: A covert C.I.A. effort to finance Somali warlords has empowered the Islamic groups it was intended to marginalize, critics say.
articles.abstract: A covert C.I.A. effort to finance Somali warlords has empowered the Islamic groups it was intended to marginalize, critics say.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 7  A covert effort by the Central Intelligence Agency to finance Somali warlords has drawn sharp criticism from American government officials who say the campaign has thwarted counterterrorism efforts inside Somalia and empowered the same Islamic groups it was intended to marginalize.

articles.headline: A Sea of Sand Is Threatening China's Heart
articles.snippet: A desert pincer is squeezing Minqin, a struggling oasis town, and China's long campaign to cultivate its vast arid northwest is in retreat.
articles.abstract: A desert pincer is squeezing Minqin, a struggling oasis town, and China's long campaign to cultivate its vast arid northwest is in retreat.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINQIN, China — China's own favorite military strategist, Sun Tzu, surely would have warned against letting two mighty enemies, the Tengger and the Badain Jaran, form a united front.

articles.headline: Motorola's Q: Lovely Phone; Ugly Software
articles.snippet: The Q is an eye-catching, extremely thin slab but getting anything done on it requires more steps than the Empire State Building.
articles.abstract: The Q is an eye-catching, extremely thin slab but getting anything done on it requires more steps than the Empire State Building.
articles.lead_paragraph: IN the beginning, there were yin and yang, blessings and curses, two sides of every coin. And now there's the Motorola Q.

articles.headline: Morgan Lures Back a Defector of Rank
articles.snippet: The return of a senior investment banker is a small coup for Morgan Stanley, which has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.
articles.abstract: The return of a senior investment banker is a small coup for Morgan Stanley, which has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Morgan Stanley said yesterday that it had secured the return of a senior investment banker, a small coup for a firm that has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.

articles.headline: A Sea of Sand Is Threatening China's Heart
articles.snippet: China's own favorite military strategist, Sun Tzu, surely would have warned against letting two mighty enemies, the Tengger and the Badain Jaran, form a united front.     Yet a desert pincer is squeezing this struggling oasis town, and China's lon...
articles.abstract: China's own favorite military strategist, Sun Tzu, surely would have warned against letting two mighty enemies, the Tengger and the Badain Jaran, form a united front.     Yet a desert pincer is squeezing this struggling oasis town, and China's long campaign to cultivate its vast arid northwest is in retreat.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINQIN, China - China's own favorite military strategist, Sun Tzu, surely would have warned against letting two mighty enemies, the Tengger and the Badain Jaran, form a united front.

articles.headline: Efforts by C.I.A. Fail in Somalia, Officials Charge
articles.snippet: A covert effort by the Central Intelligence Agency to finance Somali warlords has drawn sharp criticism from American government officials who say the campaign has thwarted counterterrorism efforts inside Somalia and empowered the same Islamic gro...
articles.abstract: A covert effort by the Central Intelligence Agency to finance Somali warlords has drawn sharp criticism from American government officials who say the campaign has thwarted counterterrorism efforts inside Somalia and empowered the same Islamic groups it was intended to marginalize.      The criticism was expressed privately by United States government officials with direct knowledge of the debate. And the comments flared even before the apparent victory this week by Islamist militias in the country dealt a sharp setback to American policy in the region and broke the warlords' hold on the capital, Mogadishu.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 7 - A covert effort by the Central Intelligence Agency to finance Somali warlords has drawn sharp criticism from American government officials who say the campaign has thwarted counterterrorism efforts inside Somalia and empowered the same Islamic groups it was intended to marginalize.

articles.headline: This Joe's for You?
articles.snippet: Three big restaurant chains are revving up efforts to take on Starbucks, which has struck it rich by serving expensive coffee to people looking for a little bit of daily luxury.      But the chains -- Dunkin' Donuts, McDonald's and Burger King -- ...
articles.abstract: Three big restaurant chains are revving up efforts to take on Starbucks, which has struck it rich by serving expensive coffee to people looking for a little bit of daily luxury.      But the chains -- Dunkin' Donuts, McDonald's and Burger King -- are not going after the Starbucks coffee snob; they're going after the average Joe.

articles.headline: With Oil's Cash, Venezuelans Consume
articles.snippet: On a recent Sunday morning here, free-spending customers have emptied Vintage, a trendy upscale bar, of nearly all its best vodka. At the Castellana Chevrolet dealership nearby, buyers wait eight months to get the keys to cars they paid for long a...
articles.abstract: On a recent Sunday morning here, free-spending customers have emptied Vintage, a trendy upscale bar, of nearly all its best vodka. At the Castellana Chevrolet dealership nearby, buyers wait eight months to get the keys to cars they paid for long ago.      And on a recent weekend at the LG Digital Store and at RCA Electronics in the Sambil mall, consumer confidence has helped strip the shelves of television sets and refrigerators.

articles.headline: Morgan Lures Back a Defector of Rank
articles.snippet: Morgan Stanley said yesterday that it had secured the return of a senior investment banker, a small coup for a firm that has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.      That the banker, Jon A. Anda, has been lured back...
articles.abstract: Morgan Stanley said yesterday that it had secured the return of a senior investment banker, a small coup for a firm that has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.      That the banker, Jon A. Anda, has been lured back from the nascent investment boutique of Joseph R. Perella, the former Morgan Stanley deal maker, is of additional satisfaction to Morgan Stanley's chief executive, John J. Mack.
articles.lead_paragraph: Morgan Stanley said yesterday that it had secured the return of a senior investment banker, a small coup for a firm that has worked hard to replenish its pool of top investment banking talent.

articles.headline: Narrow Victory by G.O.P. Signals Fall Problems
articles.snippet: The victory that Republicans squeezed out in a high-profile race to fill a Congressional vacancy here eased party anxieties Wednesday but signaled future difficulties as they confront tougher Democratic challenges in increasingly contested distric...
articles.abstract: The victory that Republicans squeezed out in a high-profile race to fill a Congressional vacancy here eased party anxieties Wednesday but signaled future difficulties as they confront tougher Democratic challenges in increasingly contested districts this fall.     The Republican candidate here, Brian P. Bilbray, won with 49 percent of the vote, defeating Francine Busby, the Democrat, who drew 45 percent, with the remaining votes going to an independent and a Libertarian, according to nearly complete returns.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO, June 7 - The victory that Republicans squeezed out in a high-profile race to fill a Congressional vacancy here eased party anxieties Wednesday but signaled future difficulties as they confront tougher Democratic challenges in increasingly contested districts this fall.

articles.headline: 2 Charged in Scheme Said to Defraud Internet Phone Providers
articles.snippet: Federal authorities yesterday arrested a Miami man who they said made more than $1 million in a hacking scheme involving the resale of Internet telephone service.     The suspect is accused of surreptitiously routing calls through the lines of leg...
articles.abstract: Federal authorities yesterday arrested a Miami man who they said made more than $1 million in a hacking scheme involving the resale of Internet telephone service.     The suspect is accused of surreptitiously routing calls through the lines of legitimate Internet phone companies, saddling them with the expense of carrying the traffic while he pocketed the connection fees from customers. A second man was arrested in Washington State, and charged with aiding in the scheme.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities yesterday arrested a Miami man who they said made more than $1 million in a hacking scheme involving the resale of Internet telephone service.
articles.byline: By Ken Belson and Tom Zeller Jr

articles.headline: TV Screen, Not Couch, Is Required for This Session
articles.snippet: Dr. Sara Gibson looked into the television screen and got right down to it.      ''What's keeping you alive at this point?'' she asked her patient, a middle-aged woman who asked to be identified only as D. D grimaced, looked down, then to the side...
articles.abstract: Dr. Sara Gibson looked into the television screen and got right down to it.      ''What's keeping you alive at this point?'' she asked her patient, a middle-aged woman who asked to be identified only as D. D grimaced, looked down, then to the side and finally into Dr. Gibson's face, which filled the screen before her in a tiny clinic three hours east of here in the Arizona desert.
articles.lead_paragraph: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz. - Dr. Sara Gibson looked into the television screen and got right down to it.

articles.headline: Motorola's Q: Lovely Phone; Ugly Software
articles.snippet: IN the beginning, there were yin and yang, blessings and curses, two sides of every coin. And now there's the Motorola Q.     It's a greatly anticipated, long-delayed cellphone with a tiny keyboard that lets you tap out e-mail and text messages wi...
articles.abstract: IN the beginning, there were yin and yang, blessings and curses, two sides of every coin. And now there's the Motorola Q.     It's a greatly anticipated, long-delayed cellphone with a tiny keyboard that lets you tap out e-mail and text messages with your thumbs. The Q offers two huge advantages over the popular BlackBerry and Treo smartphones: in Motorola's words, ''price point and form factor.''
articles.lead_paragraph: IN the beginning, there were yin and yang, blessings and curses, two sides of every coin. And now there's the Motorola Q.
